content: f r e e p a t t e r n the t r e v i a s c a r f v o v v v o o crochet until desired size o v v v o v o o o o v o the t r e v i a chart start with 3 chain stitches for the foundation plus 1 extra chain for turning work 1 single_crochet into each of the 3 chains chain 1 to turn in the first stitch of the row make 2 single crochets in the same space to increase work 1 single_crochet into each stitch across and in the last stitch make 2 single crochets again to increase chain 1 and turn continue this pattern always increasing in the first and last stitch of each row with single crochets in between add a turning chain at the end of every row repeat until the scarf reaches your desired size single chain chrochet increase single_crochet 2sc in one space the scalloped edge sc1 skip 1 5dc in next st skip 1 repeat start at the top right corner work 1 single_crochet skip 1 stitch then make 5 double crochets into the next stitch skip 1 stitch and single_crochet in the next repeat this pattern across the row i like to finish the row with a single_crochet and also begin the diagonal side with a single_crochet for an even wave on the diagonal side stitches can be harder to count because of the increases use the horizontal row as a guide and keep even spacing at the tip of the triangle be sure to place the 5 double crochets into the middle stitch of the three foundation stitches single double_crochet double_crochet chrochet 5 together size the pictured scarf was crocheted to a height of about 27 cm without edging before blocking blocking spray the scarf with water on both sides until lightly moist gently stretch and pin all around pin between each scallop and in the center of the 5 double_crochet stitches pull these slightly outward to accentuate the wavy edge let dry completely then unpin after blocking the scarf measured approx 31 cm in height and 80 cm across the top edge yarn rico design essentials baby alpaca+silk zen by lang yarns drops brushed alpaca silk 1 or 2 strands of any silk mohair mix i used a little less than 1 skein of yarn a 4-4 5 mm hook works well in line with the yarn s guidelines
